cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 35 miles ENE of Daytona Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving NNW parallel to the southeast U.S. coastline, forecast to turn north and skirt the coasts of Georgia and South Carolina before bending seaward near North Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: very near or just offshore of the South Carolina coast (around Charleston area)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – all watches south of Sebastian Inlet have been discontinued
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A – all warnings south of Sebastian Inlet have been discontinued
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast from Sebastian Inlet northward through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) with occasional higher gusts likely occurred during the night of 6–7 Oct
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible along the Palm Beach County coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain possible, producing flooding and flash-flooding in low-lying areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, large breaking waves and strong rip currents affecting port approaches
